pages.text: A stately woman, seated and crowned with a garland, having rich vestments and royal aspect, as of a daughter of heaven and earth.$(br)  A field of corn is ripening in front of her, and beyond there is a fall of water.$(br)  The sceptre which she bears is surmounted by a golden world globe.$(br)  She is the Earthly Garden of Creation, all that is symbolized by the visible house of the woman.$(br)  She is not Queen of Heaven,

but she is a sanctuary; the fruitful mother of thousands.$(br)  There are also certain aspects in which she has been correctly described as Desire and the wings thereof, and as the Most Holy Veil.$(br)  She is above all things universal fertility and the outer sense of the Word.$(br)  There is no direct message which has been given to humanity like that which is borne by woman; even if she does not herself carry its interpretation.

In other words, while the card of the Empress signifies the way for all into this life; the way out therefrom, into the beyond, is the secret known to $(l:patchouli:major/2the_high_priestess)The High Priestess$(), only told by her to the elect.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Passion, sensuality, desire. Motherhood and nurturing.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Detachment, emotional distance.$(br)  Thinking something through.
